intro: Lagarinthus virgatus, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with the flowers appearing in late summer to early fall. Lagarinthus virgatus is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
